title: The 9th-gen iPad is an unbeatable $200 off on Black Friday
content:
Macworld

This deal continues to pop up and sell out so keep trying throughout the day if the listing says it is sold out.

Apple might not sell the 9th-gen iPad anymore, but there are still many of us who love the classic Home button desgin. If that’s you, you can get one for $200 off the original MSRP for the very first time: Amazon is selling the 9th-gen iPad with 256GB of storage for just $280.

Featuring the A13 Bionic Chip, this tablet is ready to take on work, gaming, or streaming content without issue. The battery will last you long hours, while the 10.2-inch retina display will ensure you have a great time doing it. In our review of the 9th gen iPad, we gave it a 4-star rating and praised its all-around performance for the price. Now that it’s 42 percent off for Black Friday, it’s an even better buy.

It has all the things you want—a big screen, long battery life, Apple Pencil support, and a FaceTime camera. It’s not the latest or greatest, but it’s got a ton of storage and a sturdy design that’ll handle lots of abuse. So go ahead and grab your very own 9th-gen iPad for $200 off this Black Friday because this Amazon deal is unbeatable.
